UI_visible_response: The number of deaths attributed to air pollution in China has varied over recent years according to different studies. In 2017, it was estimated that 1.24 million deaths were attributable to air pollution in China1. By 2019, this figure had increased slightly to 1.85 million deaths as a result of air pollution4. Another source mentions that air pollution is responsible for about 2 million deaths in China per year, with ambient air pollution alone causing more than 1 million deaths3. These figures highlight the significant impact of air pollution on public health in China.
traffic_visible_response: The number of deaths attributed to air pollution in China has varied over recent years according to different studies. In 2017, it was estimated that 1.24 million deaths were attributable to air pollution in China [[1]]. By 2019, this figure had increased slightly to 1.85 million deaths as a result of air pollution [[4]]. Another source mentions that air pollution is responsible for about 2 million deaths in China per year, with ambient air pollution alone causing more than 1 million deaths [[3]]. These figures highlight the significant impact of air pollution on public health in China.
